description: A word of unknown origin, perhaps cognate with Scots hirple (“to limp”) or Dutch hurken (“to squat”), plus the suffix -le.

verbs.description: hurkle (third-person singular simple present hurkles, present participle hurkling, simple past and past participle hurkled)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) to draw in the parts of the body, especially with pain or cold
(of the limbs) to contract, to pull in
